intro: Kickxia commutata var. filiformis, commonly known as the slender hairgrass, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its fine, thread-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that typically bloom in early summer. The plant grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses and sedges. Due to its delicate appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
